intro: [WRONG START] Homalanthus ebracteatus, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is adapted to the tropical climate and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
